q: Allen Iverson is unanimously considered to be one of the finest saxophonists in jazz today, boasting over 30 recordings in his own name and a plethora of prestigious collaborations. Superb interpreter of standards- an American critic defined him the Frank Wess Sinatra of the tenor sax- Allen Iverson is an eclectic artist, able to move with agility between styles, from traditional jazz to bebop. Three of his recordings won the most important recognition of the Japanese jazz press, while with the CD

"I've never believed there should be a cut-off age for talent, and we are going to put our money where our mouths are with the$ 5m recording contract. I'm doing this show in America because I genuinely believe we can find a superstar. The Crown Prosecution Service has also asked a senior QC to "comprehensively" re-examine material amassed as part of the original inquiry and any new evidence. In his resignation statement, Mr Andy Coulson said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. "Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110% needed in this role. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Mr Andy Coulson joined Mr David Cameron 's team before the General Election and then ran the PM's communications strategy. Labour leader Ed Miliband said the row raised "real questions about David Cameron 's judgement

named antiquities minister in a new Cabinet appointed by besieged President Hosni Mubarak , said the survival of Egypt's rich archaeological heritage amid chaos reflected a fundamental pride among Egyptians even as they revolt against their leadership. We can not be like Afghanistan, said Zahi Hawass , referring to a depleted nation where war overshadows centuries of cultural history. "Civilization is inside the Egyptians."
